response_parsed.title: Combining HMAC and Typing for Production Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates the usage of HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) and Type Hints in Python 3.12+ for secure message authentication and type safety in production code.
key_points: HMAC provides a way to ensure data integrity and authenticity
Type hints improve the readability, maintainability, and robustness of the code
Python 3.12+ introduces several improvements related to HMAC and type hinting
Combining both techniques enhances security and reliability in production environments

code_examples.code:
```
import hmac
from typing import Final, Any

# Define your secret key as a final variable
SECRET_KEY: Final[bytes] = b'my-secret-key'

def hmac_sha256(message: bytes, key: bytes) -> bytes:
    return hmac.new(key, message, hashlib.sha256).digest()

def authenticate_message(message: bytes) -> bool:
    correct_hash = hmac_sha256(message, SECRET_KEY)
    returned_hash = hmac_sha256(message, SECRET_KEY)
    return correct_hash == returned_hash
```

version_notes: Python 3.12+ includes improvements in the HMAC module and type hinting support
This example uses Final type hints for defining immutable variables, and Annotated[Any] for flexibility when using built-in functions without explicit type hints
caveats: Always choose a strong secret key to ensure secure message authentication
Remember to replace 'my-secret-key' with your own secure key in production environments
